# Awesome Browserless [![Awesome](https://cdn.rawgit.com/sindresorhus/awesome/d7305f38d29fed78fa85652e3a63e154dd8e8829/media/badge.svg)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/awesome)
A curated list of awesome alternatives to apps tradtionally used in the web browser.

## Searching
- [Tuxi](https://github.com/Bugswriter/tuxi) - Tuxi is a cli assistant. Get answers to your questions instantly.
- [Surfraw](https://gitlab.com/surfraw/Surfraw) - Shell Users' Revolutionary Front Rage Against the Web
- [googler](https://github.com/jarun/googler) - üîéGoogle from the terminal
- [ddgr](https://github.com/jarun/ddgr) - ü¶ÜDuckDuckGo from the terminal

## Viewing images
- [e.xec.sh](https://github.com/mattLLVW/e.xec.sh) - Search and display gifs in your terminal ü¶Ñ
- [gallery-dl](https://github.com/mikf/gallery-dl) - Command-line program to download image galleries and collections from several image hosting sites
- [styli.sh](https://github.com/thevinter/styli.sh) - A CLI tool for easy wallpaper management and image fetching
Resources
- [waldl](https://github.com/pystardust/waldl) - Browse and download wallhaven.cc using sxiv
- [Quickwall](https://github.com/deepjyoti30/quickwall) - Set latest wallpapers from Unsplash from the commandline

## Weather forecast
- [wttr.in](https://github.com/chubin/wttr.in) - ‚õÖ The right way to check the weather

## View cryptocurrency exchange rates
- [rate.sx](https://github.com/chubin/rate.sx) - üí∞ curl cryptocurrencies exchange rates
- [Coinmon](https://github.com/bichenkk/coinmon) - üí∞ The cryptocurrency price tool on CLI. desktop_computer üñ•Ô∏è
- [Cointop](https://github.com/miguelmota/cointop) - A fast and lightweight interactive terminal based UI application for tracking cryptocurrencies üöÄ

## YouTube
- [youtube-dl](https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl) - Command-line program to download videos from YouTube.com and other video sites
- [youtube-viewer](https://github.com/trizen/youtube-viewer) - Lightweight YouTube client for Linux
- [pipe-viewer](https://github.com/trizen/pipe-viewer) - A lightweight YouTube client for Linux (fork of straw-viewer)
- [FreeTube](https://github.com/FreeTubeApp/FreeTube) - An Open Source YouTube app for privacy
- [NewPipe](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe) - A libre lightweight streaming front-end for Android.
- [SkyTube](https://github.com/SkyTubeTeam/SkyTube) - Copylefted libre / open source YouTube player for Android
- [Ytfzf](https://github.com/pystardust/ytfzf) - A posix script to find and watch youtube videos from the terminal. (Without API)
- [Streamlink](https://github.com/streamlink/streamlink) - Streamlink is a CLI utility which pipes video streams from various services into a video player

## Email clients
- [NeoMutt](https://github.com/neomutt/neomutt) - ‚úâÔ∏è a command line mail reader
- [Thunderbird](https://www.thunderbird.net/en-GB/) - a free email application that's easy to set up and customise
- [Mailspring](https://github.com/Foundry376/Mailspring) - üíå A beautiful, fast and fully open source mail client for Mac, Windows and Linux.

## Calendar and scheduling
- [Calcurse](https://github.com/lfos/calcurse - A text-based calendar and scheduling application
- [GNOME Calendar](https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Calendar) - Calendar application for GNOME
- [Tibivi](https://github.com/oltarzewskik/tibivi) - Terminal based, vim-like time managment tool
- [Remind](https://dianne.skoll.ca/projects/remind/) - a sophisticated calendar and alarm program

## Translations
- [Translate Shell](https://github.com/soimort/translate-shell) - üí¨ Command-line translator using Google Translate, Bing Translator, Yandex.Translate, etc.
- [Argos Translate](https://github.com/argosopentech/argos-translate) - Open-source offline translation library written in Python
- [Dialect](https://github.com/dialect-app/dialect) - A translation app for GNOME.

## Social media

### Reddit
- [redyt](https://github.com/Bugswriter/redyt) - search reddit from the commandline
- [Reddsaver](https://github.com/manojkarthick/reddsaver) - CLI tool to download saved and upvoted media from Reddit
- [TUIR](https://gitlab.com/ajak/tuir) - Browse Reddit from your terminal
- [Slide](https://github.com/ccrama/Slide) - open-source, ad-free Reddit browser for Android
- [reddio](https://gitlab.com/aaronNG/reddio) - a command-line interface for Reddit written in POSIX shell

### Twitter
- [Rainbow Stream](https://github.com/orakaro/rainbowstream) - A smart and nice Twitter client on terminal written in Python.
- [Oysttyer](https://github.com/oysttyer/oysttyer) - An interactive console text-based command-line Twitter client written in Perl

### Facebook
- [Facebook CLI](https://github.com/specious/facebook-cli) - üíª Facebook command line client

### Instagram
- [InstaLooter](https://github.com/althonos/InstaLooter) - Another API-less Instagram pictures and videos downloader.

### Mastodon
- [Tut](https://github.com/RasmusLindroth/tut) - TUI for Mastodon with vim inspired keys

### 4chan
- [chancli](https://github.com/Gimu/chancli) - 4chan CLI browsing
- [Comfy](https://gitgud.io/wolfish/comfy/) - a console application for browsing imageboards

### Misc
- [Sherlock](https://github.com/sherlock-project/sherlock) - üîé Hunt down social media accounts by username across social networks

## Twitch
- [Twire](https://f-droid.org/en/packages/com.perflyst.twire/) - open source, ad free Twitch browser and stream player for Android
- [Streamlink](https://github.com/streamlink/streamlink) - Streamlink is a CLI utility which pipes video streams from various services into a video player

## Git interfaces
- [GitHub Cli](https://github.com/cli/cli) - GitHub‚Äôs official command line tool
- [Tig](https://github.com/jonas/tig) - Text-mode interface for git
- [GitHub-Tui](https://github.com/skanehira/github-tui) - TUI client for GitHub
- [Lazygit](https://github.com/jesseduffield/lazygit) - simple terminal UI for git commands
- [Hub](https://github.com/github/hub) - A command-line tool that makes git easier to use with GitHub.
- [Lab](https://github.com/zaquestion/lab) - Lab wraps Git or Hub, making it simple to clone, fork, and interact with repositories on GitLab
- [Magit](https://magit.vc/) - A Git Porcelain inside Emacs
- [Neogit](https://github.com/TimUntersberger/neogit) - magit for neovim

## Reading E-books
- [calibre](https://calibre-ebook.com/) - the one stop solution to all your e-book needs
- [MuPDF](https://mupdf.com) - a lightweight PDF, XPS, and E-book viewer.

## News
### RSS feed readers
- [Newsboat](https://github.com/newsboat/newsboat) - An RSS/Atom feed reader for text terminals
- [Sfeed](https://codemadness.org/sfeed-simple-feed-parser.html) - an RSS and Atom parser
- [Neix](https://github.com/tomschwarz/neix) - an RSS/Atom feed reader for your terminal
- [Akregator](https://userbase.kde.org/Akregator) - automatically collects stories from RSS/Atom-enabled websites
- [Newsflash](https://gitlab.com/news-flash/news_flash_gtk) - a program designed to complement an already existing web-based RSS reader account

### Misc
- [getnews.tech](https://github.com/omgimanerd/getnews.tech) - A web server that fetches data from the News API and formats it for display in the terminal.

## Cheat sheets
- [Man pages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_page) - a form of software documentation usually found on a Unix or Unix-like operating system
- [cheat.sh](https://github.com/chubin/cheat.sh) - the only cheat sheet you need
- [tldr](https://github.com/tldr-pages/tldr) - üìö Collaborative cheatsheets for console commands
- [cheat](https://github.com/cheat/cheat) - allows you to create and view interactive cheatsheets on the command-line.

## Stackoverflow
- [so](https://github.com/samtay/so) - A terminal interface for Stack Overflow
- [rebound](https://github.com/shobrook/rebound) - Command-line tool that instantly fetches Stack Overflow results when an exception is thrown

## Wikipedia
- [wikicurses](https://github.com/ids1024/wikicurses) - A simple curses interface for MediaWiki sites such as Wikipedia.

## Radio and podcasts
- [Castero](https://github.com/xgi/castero) -  TUI podcast client
- [ncspot](https://github.com/hrkfdn/ncspot) - Cross-platform ncurses Spotify client written in Rust, inspired by ncmpc and the likes.
- [curseradio](https://github.com/chronitis/curseradio) - Command line radio player
- [Shortwave](https://gitlab.gnome.org/World/Shortwave) - Listen to internet radio

## Office work
- [LibreOffice](https://www.libreoffice.org/) - a free and powerful office suite
- [sc-im](https://github.com/andmarti1424/sc-im) - An ncurses spreadsheet program
- [LaTeX](https://www.latex-project.org) - a high-quality typesetting system
- [Groff](https://www.gnu.org/software/groff) - a typesetting system that reads plain text mixed with formatting commands and produces formatted output
- [sent](https://tools.suckless.org/sent) - Simple plaintext presentation tool.
- [Markdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown) - a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor
- [Slides](https://github.com/maaslalani/slides) - Terminal based presentation tool
- [lookatme](https://github.com/d0c-s4vage/lookatme) - An interactive, terminal-based markdown presenter

## Password Managers
- [KeePassXC](https://github.com/keepassxreboot/keepassxc) - a cross-platform community-driven port of the Windows application ‚ÄúKeepass Password Safe‚Äù.
- [pass](https://www.passwordstore.org) - the standard unix password manager
- [Bitwarden-CLI](https://github.com/bitwarden/cli) - The command line vault (Windows, macOS, & Linux).

## Anime
- [ani-cli](https://github.com/pystardust/ani-cli) - A cli tool to browse and play anime
- [crunchyroll-cli](https://github.com/koalagang/crunchyroll-cli) - A CLI tool for browsing and playing anime from Crunchyroll.
- [Trackma](https://github.com/z411/trackma) - Open multi-site list manager for Unix-like systems. (ex-wMAL)

## Flash cards
- [Anki](https://apps.ankiweb.net) - Powerful, intelligent flash cards. Remembering things just became much easier.
- [fla.sh](https://github.com/tallguyjenks/fla.sh) - üí• flashcards in your terminal
- [Vocage](https://github.com/proycon/vocage) - A minimalistic spaced-repetion vocabulary trainer (flashcards) for the terminal

## Dictionary
- [Translate Shell](https://github.com/soimort/translate-shell) - üí¨ Command-line translator using Google Translate, Bing Translator, Yandex.Translate, etc. [use the `-d` flag for dictionary definitions]
- [dictd](https://github.com/mkuhn/dict) - Dictionary with arbitrary keys and values for R

## PDF viewers
- [Zathura](https://git.pwmt.org/pwmt/zathura) - a highly customizable and functional document viewer based on the girara user interface library and several document libraries
- [MuPDF](https://mupdf.com) - a lightweight PDF, XPS, and E-book viewer.

## BONUS
- [parrot.live](https://github.com/hugomd/parrot.live) - üê¶ Bringing animated parrots to terminals everywhere
- [Ricksay](https://github.com/bavllymagid/ricksay) - Rick & Morty quotes of the day with ponies included!
- [Ferdi](https://getferdi.com) - a free and opensource all-in-one desktop app that helps you organize how you use your favourite apps
- [Rambox](https://rambox.app) - Workspace simplifier
- [QRenco.de](https://github.com/chubin/qrenco.de) - QRenco.de a string using curl
- [TermBin](https://www.termbin.com) - Netcat-based command line pastebin.
- [Null Pointer](http://0x0.st) - No-bullshit file hosting and URL shortening service
- [Flashpoint](https://bluemaxima.org/flashpoint) - a webgame preservation project.
